intro: Tetrapterys rzedowskii, commonly known as the Mexican stinging nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and fine, hair-like structures that can cause skin irritation upon contact. Its small green flowers are clustered in spikes and are typically wind-pollinated. Tetrapterys rzedowskii often grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
